title: Clinical Competency Assessment Course Through Veterinary Virtual Reality Simulation

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental veterinary science theory and foundational clinical practice knowledge
context.additional_context: Small-group intensive education using a smartphone-based VR platform. A project-based learning environment evaluating scientific knowledge, technical skills, and ethical judgment through real emergency simulations.

learning_goals: Achievement of systematic medical triage decision-making capabilities for mass casualty incident scenarios in virtual reality simulations.
Evaluation of the ability to apply scientific knowledge and skills based on NAVMEC core competencies (diagnosis, treatment, communication, ethical judgment).
Demonstration of the ability to establish emergency response strategies utilizing teamwork and leadership competencies in a VR-based collaborative environment.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
